intro: Malvaviscus candidus, commonly known as the white-flowered mallows, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pink flowers that bloom throughout the summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Malvaviscus candidus is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
